Census Dissemination Unit (CDU)</depositr>         <depDate date="2008-06-12T00:00:00Z">12 June 2008</depDate>         <distDate date="2008-06-30T00:00:00Z">30 June 2008</distDate>       </distStmt>       <verStmt>         <version date="2013-10-02T00:00:00Z">2</version>       </verStmt>       <holdings URI="http://dx.doi.org/10.5255/UKDA-SN-5850-1" />     </citation>     <stdyInfo>       <subject>         <keyword>1991</keyword>         <keyword>2001</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/ad78d78e-6267-460b-af47-8b8bc1c5c587">ADMINISTRATIVE AREAS</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/4d35d32e-682e-45b3-b6c5-5f61b35cdc61">POVERTY</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/78825888-169d-4dfe-9edd-ab62b3a75ba8">RELATIVE DEPRIVATION</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/4f2133d1-d70d-4139-a8c2-434e8fac3c9f">SOCIO-ECONOMIC INDICATORS</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/4a821930-5499-4bb4-b058-ab0ae3c8746b">UNITED KINGDOM</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/6d26368f-860b-4020-a867-a7a65e5c4720">UNITS OF MEASUREMENT</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/edcf9d6d-1409-4a55-9913-ec0fd8e49c4f">WEALTH</keyword>         <topcClas>Population censuses - Population, vital statistics and censuses</topcClas>         <topcClas>Reference sources - Reference and instructional resources</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>These deprivation scores are based on those created by Townsend, Morris, Carstairs, Jarman and the Department of the Environment (DoE).<br> <br> Calculating measures of deprivation is perhaps one of the commonest uses of census data. Data on, for example, housing, employment, social class and availability of cars are used to create a single measure of area deprivation. There are various measures of deprivation that use different census variables or give different weights to the same variables.<br> <br> In addition, the <a href="http://census.ukdataservice.ac.uk/get-data/related/deprivation.aspx" title="Deprivation data">Deprivation data</a> webpage at UK Data Service Census Support provides more information and links to related measures available elsewhere.<br> <br> These data are restricted to staff and students from UK further/higher education institutions. If your intended use of the data involves partnership with or funding from any non-academic organisations or individuals, or if you are uncertain about whether your use of the data is entirely academic, please <a href="http://ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx" title="Get in touch">Get in touch</a>.<br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The following deprivation scores can be downloaded: <br> <ul><li>2001 Carstairs and Townsend Scores</li><li>1991 Carstairs Scores</li><li>1991 Townsend Scores</li><li>1991 DoE, Jarman, Carstairs and Townsend Scores</li></ul></abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd event="start" date="1991-01-01T00:00:00Z">1991</timePrd>         <timePrd event="end" date="2001-01-01T00:00:00Z">2001</timePrd>         <nation>United Kingdom</nation>         <geogUnit>Enumeration Districts</geogUnit>         <geogUnit>Wards (Electoral)</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Administrative units (geographical/political)</anlyUnit>         <universe>Subnational</universe>         <universe>1991 and 2001 census data</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Aggregate (macro) level</dataKind>         <dataKind>Deprivation scores</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Cross-sectional (one-time) study</timeMeth>         <sampProc>No sampling (total universe)</sampProc>         <collMode>Compilation or synthesis of existing material</collMode>         <sources>           <dataSrc>1991 and 2001 census data</dataSrc>         </sources>         <weight>See the <a href="http://census.ukdataservice.ac.uk/get-data/related/deprivation.aspx" title="Deprivation data">Deprivation data</a> webpage at UK Data Service Census Support</weight>         <cleanOps>B</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac><a href=http://census.ukdataservice.ac.uk/get-data/aggregate-data.aspx>UK Data Service Census support - aggregate data </a></accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Restricted access</specPerm>         <restrctn>Access is restricted to users in UK higher and further education institutions. Registration is required.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>         <conditions>These data are restricted to staff and students from UK further/higher education institutions. If your intended use of the data involves partnership with or funding from any non-academic organisations or individuals, or if you are uncertain about whether your use of the data is entirely academic, please <a href="http://ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx" title="Get in touch">Get in touch</a>.</conditions>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relStdy>3182 1991 Census: Small Area Statistics by 1981 Census Wards; Great Britain </relStdy>       <relStdy>5048 1991 Census: Aggregate Data; Northern Ireland </relStdy>       <relStdy>5835 2001 Census: Aggregate Data </relStdy>       <relStdy>22001 1991 Census: Aggregate Data; Great Britain </relStdy>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Documentation: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
